page.title: 03ECOLOGY,CLIMATE
page.content:
A climatological station has been maintained at TREDUSTAN HALL, on the edge of this area, since 1978. This provides a measure of the temperatures and rainfall which are to be experienc -ed in Cwm Treweren at a height of about 200 metres above sea level.
RAINFALL The average annual rainfall is 1556 millimetres with a range of 238 mm between the wettest and driest years. November and December are usually the two wettest months; May and June are the driest. There is an average of 242 days with rain. In other words rain falls on two days out of three. The wettest day so far recorded was 27th December 1979 when 122.4 mm of rain fell.
